instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST's OK. 4 issues, maybe linked
threads.message:
Hello all. Hope your all keeping well and safe.
So, I have in an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Logicboard is immaculate. When first powered on the progress bar will only go about 10%. after about 2 mins, fans will spin fast. Goes no further. Powering on to the boot options, two options available. One is Macintosh HD which will boot to the login screen. Other is Macintosh Install which again only goes to 10% on the progress bar. On both options fast fan spin. In the Macintosh HD once at the desktop, there is no battery indicator. When looking at the system report, shows no battery. Restart and press D on post, the results come up No Battery Detected. This is a Mid 2018 machine.
Looking at the schematic, Page 66 Battery Hotbar Pads when I test <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> i get 12.58v and there is no short to ground, so I know power is getting the the battery.

Main question is this, Will the battery not being detected cause the fast fan spin and the inability to reinstall/ upgrade the OSx?
I suspect the battery to be faulty but want to rule out any other issues first. Dont want to buy a battery incase I am a line/ sensor down somewhere.

As always, any help is greatfully received.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST's OK. 4 issues, maybe linked
threads.message:
Trying known good battery, is the best option.
Doesn't have a special enable screw?
Clean battery contacts.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST's OK. 4 issues, maybe linked
threads.message: Morning [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] . I have cleaned the contacts already. I also tested the battery itself and it's showing 0.001v, so completly flat. Even with the battery disconnected, I still get the fast fans and inability to run/ install and OSx. This also happens if I try to boot from a live external drive. Would the battery issue cause the other two issues?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST's OK. 4 issues, maybe linked
threads.message:
I have also checked <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> = 0V/ <SIGNAL>SMBUS_3V3_BATT_SCL</SIGNAL> 3.374V /<SIGNAL>SMBUS_3V3_BATT_SCA</SIGNAL> 3/374V/ <SIGNAL>BMON_IOUT</SIGNAL> 0.007V
Not sure if this info helps

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> POST's OK. 4 issues, maybe linked
threads.message:
You cannot get voltage on battery alone; must be enabled.
Is the enable screw properly tight?

For other symptoms, you can try DFU recovery, to discard T2 issue.
